action.action-desc: Ms. Letlow (for herself, Ms. Tokuda, Mr. James, and Mr. Ciscomani) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To modify the program of grants to support high-quality charter schools.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Empower Charter School Educators to Lead Act.

section.header: Grants to support high-quality charter schools
section.text: Section 4303 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7221b) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(C), by striking and after the semicolon;

clause.text: by inserting which may include assistance in locating and accessing a facility and funding a revolving loan fund or a similar mechanism for expenses under subsection (h) prior to an eligible applicant receiving reimbursement, after paragraph (1),; and
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: provide pre-charter planning subgrants (in amounts of no more than $100,000 per prospective applicant) to charter school developers that have not yet submitted an application for a charter to an authorized public chartering agency, or to nonprofit or public entities for the provision of financial support to such developers, provided that such developers—

clause.text: with not less than 54 months of school-based experience (which may include experience in teaching in or administering after school or summer school programs); and
that have demonstrated leadership competencies and success with students, as determined by the State entity; and

subparagraph.text: have successfully completed the development of an initial plan for opening a public charter school, as evidenced by a description of the educational needs of the community in which the proposed charter school will be located and how the planned charter school will be suited to meet those needs.
in subparagraph (A), by striking 90 percent and inserting 80 percent;

clause.text: by striking not less than 7 percent and inserting not more than 10 percent; and
by striking and after the semicolon;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D), as redesignated by subparagraph (C), by striking 3 percent and inserting 5 percent; and
by inserting after subparagraph (B) the following:
reserve not more than 5 percent of such funds to carry out the activities described in subsection (b)(3); and
